subject: Procedure for appointment of DRB Member/ Arbitrator/ Advocate/ Techno Legal Expert etc. in case of disputes relating to SPVs.
text: HRrrfy <75fly ~TTHT gifaqrrot 3414 Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (7em 4Raa7t &r rthrf #Anqw) 4787 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QGA. /Extn = 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 01-5  6, Arr-10, ETrar;, 7f frrt _ 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Dethi-110075 No. 11041/217/2007-Admn: Date: 9.7.2010 POLICY MATTERS: ADMINISTRATION FINANCE (67/2010) (Decision taken on the file no NHAIDR&A CellDRB/2O1O) Sub: Procedure   for appointment of DRB  Member/Arbitrator/Advocate/Techno Legal Expert etc  in case of disputes relating to SPVs It has been observed in that Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) created by NHAI for various purposes have been approaching to the Technical Division/Legal & Arbitration Cell of NHAI for appointment of DRB Member/Arbitrator/ Advocate/Techno Legal Expert etc  in case of disputes between the SPVs and the Contractors. 2_ In this connection, it is clarified to all concerned that SPVs are the distinct legal entities aS per the provision of Indian Companies Act and in case of dispute the appointment of DRB Member/Arbitrator/Advocate/Techno Legal Expert etc. by NHAI as per the Contract/Agreement would not be legally appropriate. 3_ It is further clarified that as per the definition of the employer contained in the contract agreement is the 'party who will employ to carryout the work(s) such as appointment of DRB Member/Arbitrator/Advocate/Techno Legal Expert etc. on behalf of the SPV is beyond the jurisdiction of NHAI 4 In  view of the above, the appointment of DRB Member/Arbitrator/Advocate/Techno Legal Expert etc, in case(s) of any dispute is to be governed in accordance with the provisions of the agreement entered into between SPV & Contractor and to be dealt with by the Competent Authority of the Management of the SPV. 0 (S.
